newsitem.title: USA: AMEX lists new security on "index of indexes".
newsitem.headline: AMEX lists new security on "index of indexes".

text.p: The American Stock Exchange (AMEX) said Tuesday it began trading Merrill Lynch & Co Major 8 European Index Market Index Target-Term Securities, or MITTS.
The exchange said $72 million of the five-year securities were issued at $10.
By about 1045 CDT/1545 GMT, the securities, were trading at 9-7/8 on volume of 45,200.
The EMX is a capitalization-weighted "index of indexes" whose components include the UK's FTSE-10, Germany's Deutscher Aktienindex and France's CAC 40 index.
Also, the Swiss Market Index, the Amsterdam European Options Exchange Index, the Milano Italia Borsa 30 Index, the Stockholm Options Market Index and Spain's IBEX 35 Index.
The EMX MITTS expire on August 30, 2002 and at that time, holders will receive 100 percent principal return.
Also at maturity, if the index has increased from its initial spot level of 100, holders will receive a supplemental amount determined by multiplying the gain by 110 percent.
At about 1045 CDT/1545 GMT, the EMX was trading at 99.64.
"This product offers investors Pan-European diversification through a single investment," Richard Mikaliunas, Senior Vice President of Capital Markets at the AMEX, said in a statement.
The AMEX specialist for the new MITTS is Cranmer & Cranmer/Raymar Capital Inc.
